page.title: 06INTERVIEW: FORMER PUPILS
page.content: {MEMORIES OF SCHOOL:1957 When Mrs. Aileen Kinnaird came to this school there were only nine pupils. Her best subjects were Art & English. At break the children would play with skipping ropes,or perhaps play 'housies' and schools. She feels that the main differences in schools now is that there are more varied subjects and that children now have the benefit of visiting teachers. {STOER SCHOOL: 1910 Mr. Rory Mackenzie remembers having to walk the two miles to{Stoer School {from Clashnessie}in all sorts of weather. Most of the children spoke {Gaelic}until they came into the classroom where they were required to speak English. He enjoyed playing football at the side of the school. Now the old 'football pitch' is boggy and covered with heath.
